title: PS4 Pro vs PS4: Which is the best buy? | Trusted Reviews
description: ![PS4 Pro vsPS4]()################ PS4 Pro vs PS4 – GamesThere’s no such thing as a ‘PS4 Pro Exclusive’ game. Games must be enhancedfor PS4 Pro, but Sony won’t allow any game to only run on PS4 Pro.All PS4 games must now support a PS4 Pro mode with improved graphics andperformance, but some games do this better than others.**[Horizon Zero Dawn](https://www.trustedreviews.com/horizon-zero-dawn-review)** : This is the first PS4 exclusive designed specifically with the PS4Pro in mind. It looks stunning, so it’s must-have for any PS4 Pro owner.**[Resident Evil 7](https://www.trustedreviews.com/resident-evil-7-review):**An excellent game that really benefits from HDR, adding to the already creepyfeeling throughout the game.**[Rise of the Tomb Raider](https://www.trustedreviews.com/rise-of-the-tomb-raider-review): ** One of the best examples of PS4 Pro upgrades. While itdoesn’t support HDR, visual improvements in both ‘4K’ and 1080p make this is avisual treat.**[The Last Guardian](https://www.trustedreviews.com/the-last-guardian-review):** Supports both 4K and 1080p high performance modes on PS4 Pro andthe HDR. HDR works on the existing PS4 as well, however.**[The Last of Us Remastered](https://www.trustedreviews.com/the-last-of-us-remastered-review):** Probably the best game for HDR in the PS4 Pro line-up,it supports native 4K at 60fps and looks great.**[Hitman](https://www.trustedreviews.com/hitman-review):** No HDR support,but both performance and textures are improved on PS4 Pro.**[Battlefield 1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/battlefield-1-review):** Oneof the best PS4 Pro upgrades around. There’s more terrain detail and you’lleven get a performance advantage in busy multiplayer games.**[Watch Dogs 2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/watch-dogs-2-review):** Looksgreat in the 4K and 1080p supersampled versions thanks to improved anti-aliasing[**The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/the-witcher-3-wild-hunt): CD Projekt Red recently updated its epic RPG to fullysupport HDR and 4K upscaling and, as predicted, it looks pretty stunning.**Related:[Red Dead Redemption 2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/red-dead-redemption-2-release-date-news-rumours-and-trailers-round-up-2912356)**## Does the PS4 Pro play 4K Blu-ray discs?Sadly, no. While the Xbox One S supports [Ultra HD Blu-ray](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/what-is-ultra-hd-blu-ray), thePS4 Pro doesn’t and won’t in future. It does support 4K HDR content from thelikes of Netflix, however.If you do want to play Ultra HD Blu-rays, read our guide to the best Blu-rayplayers, or buy an Xbox One S.## PS4 Pro vs PS4: Conclusion**Don’t upgrade if you own a PS4 and have a 1080p TV.** Until you decide toupgrade to a 4K TV, I see no sense in spending more to buy a PS4 Pro. The costoutweighs the benefits. It’s worth upgrading if you’re buying a new 4K TV, butif you can’t afford both then buy the TV first. Our [best 4K TVguide](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-4k-tvs_round-up) is a good place tostart.**Seriously consider upgrading if you own already a 4K TV.** I can’t outrightrecommend you buy a PS4 Pro, but there are plenty of compelling reasons to doso. Games look great on a 4K TV on a PS4 Pro and upcoming releases like MassEffect: Andromeda and Horizon: Zero Dawn are showing great promise. Onlyreconsider if you want but don’t already own an Ultra HD Blu-ray player, or ifyou own a budget 4K TV that lacks HDR support. Head to [best Blu-rayplayers](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-blu-ray-players_round-up) for ourtop picks.**Buy a PS4 Pro if you don’t own a PS4 already.** Provided you can afford it,of course. Even if you don’t own a 4K TV, a PS4 Pro will give you faster andbetter looking games and is future proof should you upgrade your TV in future.And if you can’t afford a PS4 Pro, the existing PS4 will play all the samegames and remains a great console.
